item.description:
*************************************
Smithsonian Observatory

HARVARD-SMITHSONIAN CENTER FOR ASTROPHYSICS
60 GARDEN STREET
CAMBRIDGE, MA 02138
has their monthly public viewing this week on the 3rd Thursday night.

Drive up to the back, up the hill. The Lecture's up the stairs opposite the lil observatory-in-a-box.

*************************************
from the CfA:

"How to Build a Planet," Meredith Hughes, CfA
Where did the Earth come from, and how can we know? Is our solar system "normal," or not? How can dust particles no larger than those in cigarette smoke clump together to make a planet thousands of miles across? Tonight's lecture will explore the miraculous and messy process of planet formation, using clues from as far as the Orion Nebula and as near as your own backyard to tease out the evidence of our cosmic origin.

This event takes place at 7:30 pm on Thursday at Phillips Auditorium, 60 Garden Street, Cambridge. Doors open at 7:00. Seating is first-come, first-served and admission is free. Free parking is available to everyone after 5 pm. (Ignore the "staff only" signs.)

If weather permits, rooftop observing through telescopes will follow the presentation.

For more information or directions, visit http://www.cfa.harvar... or call (617) 495-7461.
***********************************************
item.how_to_find_us: I'll carry a meetup sign before and afterwards.
item.name: Smithsonian Observatory Public Viewing Night
